entry.def: Negotiators are people who take part in political or financial negotiations.

example.ex: ...the rebels' chief negotiator at the peace talks...
example.tran: 和谈中叛乱分子的首席谈判代表

example.ex: The two American negotiators are calling for substantial cuts in external subsidies.
example.tran: 两名美国谈判代表正在呼吁大量削减外部援助。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who negotiates (confers with others in order to reach a settlement)

Sentence.sentence: Or you can be the honest type negotiator who's known to his partners in negotiation and always plays everything straight.
So really, you see two types of negotiator then, the actor or the honest one
I would say the honest negotiator can be quite effective in some circumstances.

sentences.en: He is a negotiator of considerable skill.
Smith is a most suitable candidate for such negotiator since his tact and quickness of mind are equal to the occasion.
sentences.cn: 这样的谈判史密斯先生是最合适的人选,他机智敏捷,随机应变。

sentences.en: They have placed great trust in him as a negotiator.
sentences.cn: 他们完全信赖他进行谈判。
